questions.question: 1. What is the primary function of a controlled bridge rectifier?

answers.a: To convert DC to AC voltage
answers.b: To convert AC to DC voltage
answers.c: To boost the AC input voltage
answers.d: To convert AC to AC voltage

explanations.b: Explanation 2: The primary function of a controlled bridge rectifier is to convert AC into a controlled output DC voltage by adjusting the firing angles of the thyristors.

questions.question: 2. Which component is used for controlling the output voltage of a controlled bridge rectifier?

explanations.b: Explanation 2: Thyristors are used in AC to DC controlled bridge rectifiers to control the output DC voltage by adjusting the firing angles.

questions.question: 3. How many Thyristors are required to implement single-phase fully-controlled bridge rectifier circuit?

explanations.d: Explanation 4: A single-phase fully-controlled bridge rectifier requires four thyristors which are arranged in a bridge configuration.
